title: 108_hr4898
content: The "Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004" allows for coverage of additional preventive services deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The "Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004" expands coverage to include additional preventive services defined in subsection (bbb)(1) of the Social Security Act. The new subsection defines additional preventive services as items and services, including mental health services, deemed necessary for illness or disability prevention. The Secretary considers evidence-based recommendations and uses a national coverage determination process. Payment and cost-sharing elimination are addressed in Section 1833(a)(1) of the Social Security Act. The Medicare Act is amended to include coverage for additional preventive services, with payment at 100 percent of the actual charge or fee schedule amount. Coinsurance is eliminated in outpatient hospital settings. Coinsurance is eliminated in outpatient hospital settings. Section 1833(t)(1)(B)(iv) of the Social Security Act is amended to include diagnostic mammography and additional preventive services. Conforming amendments are made to section 1833(a)(2) of the Social Security Act. The Medicare Act is amended to cover additional preventive services in outpatient hospital settings, with payment at 100 percent of the actual charge or fee schedule amount. Coinsurance is eliminated for these services. Deductible waiver applies to these services as well. Coinsurance is eliminated for these services, and the deductible waiver applies. The amendments made by this section apply to services furnished on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
